final_answer:
The humor in this image comes from its satirical take on airplane safety instructions. On the left, we see traditional safety panels, which are calm and straightforward, depicting typical in-flight emergency procedures. This part is labeled "YES," indicating adherence to safety protocols.

On the right, labeled "BUT," the scene depicts an exaggerated and chaotic scenario: a businessperson is humorously running on a runway-like path extending from the airplane, with small figures falling out behind. This absurd contrast highlights the impracticality and panic that would occur in an actual emergency, poking fun at how real-life situations rarely follow a calm set of instructions. The juxtaposition of orderly instructions with a chaotic and unrealistic escape scenario creates a comedic effect.
